meanings.sent1: I feel sick and might boke after eating that spoiled food.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, when people feel unwell, they boke.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride made me boke, but it was still fun.
meanings.sent4: The horrible smell of the garbage made her boke instantly.
meanings.sent5: The thought of eating snails made her boke uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: After the boat ride, she felt boke in her stomach.
meanings.sent2: His face turned pale, a sign of boke coming on.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the slimy fish caused boke in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the rotten eggs filled the room with boke.
meanings.sent5: The intense spinning of the carnival ride brought on boke for many.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nausea or disgust
meanings.sent1: The taste of the medicine left a lingering boke in her mouth.
meanings.sent2: The gruesome scene in the movie caused a wave of boke in the audience.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk had a strong boke that lingered in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The thought of eating bugs filled her with boke.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the food brought on an instant boke for him.
